intro: Calandrinia lamprosperma, commonly known as the showy sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Calandrinia lamprosperma is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies due to its nectar-rich flowers.
